commands.title: Global Warming: A Looming Crisis
commands.subtitle: Understanding the Causes, Impacts, and Solutions

slides.title: The Earth is Warming: An Urgent Call to Action
slides.content: Global warming refers to the long-term heating of Earth's climate system observed since the pre-industrial period (between 1850 and 1900) due to human activities, primarily fossil fuel burning, which increases heat-trapping greenhouse gas levels in Earth's atmosphere.

elements.description: A stylized drawing of the Earth with a thermometer showing rising temperatures, fading from light blue to orange.
Fade transition

slides.title: Causes of Global Warming: Human Activity
slides.content: The primary driver of global warming is the emission of greenhouse gases, mainly carbon dioxide (CO2) and methane (CH4). These gases trap heat in the atmosphere, leading to a gradual increase in global temperatures. Burning fossil fuels (coal, oil, and natural gas) for energy, deforestation, and industrial processes are the main sources of these emissions.

elements.description: A collage of images representing fossil fuel burning, deforestation, and industrial emissions, arranged in a thought bubble shape emanating from a silhouette of a human head.
Morph transition

slides.title: Greenhouse Gases: The Invisible Threat
slides.content: Key Greenhouse Gases include: Carbon Dioxide (CO2) - from burning fossil fuels, deforestation. Methane (CH4) - from agriculture, natural gas leaks. Nitrous Oxide (N2O) - from agriculture, industrial activities. Fluorinated Gases - from industrial processes, refrigeration.

elements.description: A visual representation of the greenhouse effect, showing sunlight entering the atmosphere and some of the heat being trapped by greenhouse gases. Gases are represented by stylized, transparent blue shapes.
Push transition

slides.title: Impacts of Global Warming: A Changing World
slides.content: Rising global temperatures are causing a range of impacts, including: More frequent and intense heatwaves. Rising sea levels due to melting glaciers and thermal expansion. Changes in precipitation patterns, leading to droughts and floods. Increased ocean acidity, harming marine life. Disruption of ecosystems and biodiversity loss.

elements.description: A series of interconnected illustrations showing the various impacts of global warming: a melting glacier, a flooded city, a parched field, and a dying coral reef.
Wipe transition

slides.title: Melting Ice: A Rising Tide
slides.content: Glaciers and ice sheets are melting at an alarming rate, contributing to rising sea levels. This threatens coastal communities and ecosystems worldwide. Arctic sea ice is also declining, impacting polar bear populations and altering ocean currents.

elements.description: A before-and-after image of a glacier, showing the dramatic reduction in ice cover over time.  Use a wavy line to separate the images and show water flowing between them.
Split transition

slides.title: Extreme Weather: The New Normal?
slides.content: Climate change is increasing the frequency and intensity of extreme weather events, such as hurricanes, floods, droughts, and wildfires. These events can cause significant damage to infrastructure, agriculture, and human lives.

elements.description: A swirling vortex of images representing different types of extreme weather events, with a dark blue color scheme.
Random Bars transition

slides.title: The Ocean's Acidification: A Silent Killer
slides.content: As the ocean absorbs excess CO2 from the atmosphere, it becomes more acidic. This harms marine life, particularly shellfish and coral reefs, which are vital to ocean ecosystems. Ocean acidification threatens the food chain and the livelihoods of millions of people who depend on the ocean for food and income.

elements.description: An illustration showing healthy coral reefs gradually bleaching and dying due to ocean acidification. Use a gradient from vibrant colors to pale, washed-out tones.
Cover transition

slides.title: Solutions: A Path to a Sustainable Future
slides.content: Transitioning to renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydro). Improving energy efficiency in buildings and transportation. Reducing deforestation and promoting reforestation. Developing and deploying carbon capture technologies. Adopting sustainable agricultural practices. International cooperation and policy changes.

elements.description: A circular diagram showing the different solutions to global warming, with each solution represented by a stylized icon (e.g., solar panel, wind turbine, tree seedling).
Uncover transition

slides.title: Renewable Energy: Powering a Cleaner World
slides.content: Renewable energy sources, such as solar, wind, and hydro power, offer a clean and sustainable alternative to fossil fuels. Investing in renewable energy technologies can create jobs, reduce pollution, and mitigate climate change.

elements.description: An image showcasing various renewable energy sources in action: a solar farm, a wind farm, and a hydroelectric dam, set against a clear blue sky.
Zoom transition

slides.title: The Future is in Our Hands: Act Now!
slides.content: Global warming is a serious threat, but it is not too late to take action. By reducing our greenhouse gas emissions and adopting sustainable practices, we can create a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable future for ourselves and future generations. Every action counts!

elements.description: A drawing of hands holding a seedling, symbolizing hope and growth, with a blue and green color scheme.
Flash transition
